info.headline: Flash Flood Warning issued June 26 at 1:56AM CDT until June 26 at 2:45AM CDT by NWS Hastings NE
info.description:
...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 245 AM CDT EARLY THIS MORNING FOR NORTHEASTERN HALL COUNTY...
At 156 AM CDT, Emergency management along with Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated that although the very heaviest of rain has moved away, extensive flooding and flash flooding continues within and near the Grand Island city limits. Between 3 and 7 inches of rain have fallen in the last 12 hours, most of which occurred during the last four hours, and additional rainfall amounts up to around 1 inch are still possible in the warned area before rain ends later this morning. Flash flooding is already occurring.
This is a FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY for the city of Grand Island. . This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW!
HAZARD...Life threatening flash flooding. Thunderstorms producing flash flooding.
SOURCE...Emergency management reported.
IMPACT...This is a PARTICULARLY DANGEROUS SITUATION. SEEK HIGHER GROUND NOW! Life threatening flash flooding of low water crossings, small creeks and streams, urban areas, highways, streets and underpasses.
Some locations that will experience flash flooding include... Grand Island.
This includes the following streams and drainages... Warm Slough, Moores Creek, Silver Creek, Wood River and Prairie Creek.
info.instruction:
Move to higher ground now! This is an extremely dangerous and life-threatening situation. Do not attempt to travel unless you are fleeing an area subject to flooding or under an evacuation order.
Turn around, don't drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.

parameter.value: FLASH FLOOD EMERGENCY FOR THE CITY OF GRAND ISLAND.
